definition: to do/to grow/to write or compose/to pretend/to regard as/to feel/writings or works
artificial show of seriousness/to pretend to be solemn

sentences.english: Many believe that is posturing on Buck's part but Arsenal are digging their heels in.
sentences.chinese: 很多人認爲這是在故作姿態，但阿森那還在固執着。

sentences.english: Amused by her mock seriousness, I moved to her right breast.
sentences.chinese: 她的故作嚴肅真好玩，我就湊向她的右乳。

sentences.english: I turn and do my best to smile and look calm and ask what's the matter.
sentences.chinese: 我回過頭努力力地微笑，並故作鎮靜地問有什麼問題。

sentences.english: His concern for the poor is a mere pose.
sentences.chinese: 他關心窮人只是故作姿態罷了。

sentences.english: Posturing by the govt. . Why are steps not taken with the Chinese?
sentences.chinese: 政府在故作姿態，爲什麼就不對中國人採取措施？

sentences.english: I am a dreamer but when I wake
sentences.chinese: 我耽於做夢。在夢醒之時我故作堅強

sentences.english: When you say invisible, " interrupted Albert, it is only to keep up the mystery".
sentences.chinese: “你說沒有看到，”阿爾貝插嘴說，別故作神祕了吧。

sentences.english: He pretended to open a true hid himself I annoyed mood.
sentences.chinese: 故作開朗的他，向賢真躲藏了本人懊惱的心情。

sentences.english: Mr. Ford's indifference to his competitors is no pose.
sentences.chinese: 福特先生對競爭對手的漠不關心並非故作姿態。

sentences.english: Many maintain that Britain should give up the pretence of being a busy power.
sentences.chinese: 許多人認爲，英國該停止打腫臉充胖子，故作繁忙了。

sentences.english: She loves to pose when men are around.
sentences.chinese: 當有男人在四周時她喜歡裝腔作勢，故作姿態。

sentences.english: Before answering, he harrumphed for calm.
sentences.chinese: 回答問題之前，他故作鎮靜地清了清嗓子。

sentences.english: Pretending to be non-sage can not, then the Sage grams and out.
sentences.chinese: 故作非聖人不能，而述則賢者克及。

sentences.english: Her refusal was merely a deliberate gesture.
sentences.chinese: 她的拒絕只是故作姿態。

sentences.english: She is being charming at the party.
Do not testify against your neighbor without cause, or use your lips to deceive.
sentences.chinese: 不可無故作見證陷害鄰舍，也不可用嘴欺騙人。

definition: not in the least concerned (idiom)/reckless/couldn't give a damn about it/unperturbed/couldn't care less/harum scarum
to pretend/to feign/to act a part
as if nothing had happened (idiom); calmly/nonchalantly
not a word or movement (idiom); remaining calm and collected/not batting an eyelid
to put on an act (idiom); to show affectation/to indulge in histrionics
